flawed_nl_solution:
Marvin sold 35 candy bars at $2 each so 35 * 2 = $<<35*2=70>>70 worth of candy
Tina sold three times the amount of candy so $70 * 3 = $<<70*3=201>>201 worth of candy
If Tina sold $201 worth of candy and Marvin sold $70 in candy then 201 - 70 = $<<201-70=131>>131 more sold than Marvin

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 210, not 201. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
